website_summaries.verdict: Undoubtedly the most innovative shovel on the market. Its soil-busting abilities make it a solid investment for any gardener's tool collection.
pros: Seriously powerful with a unique, patented spade-like design that provides the strength and leverage to tackle tough, rocky soil and clay
Spear-shaped head also does a good job with various planting tasks
cons: The handle may seem a bit short for taller consumers, but a long-handled model is also available

customer_reviews.title: Root Domination
customer_reviews.text: This tool was just perfect for dividing some overgrown ornamental grasses and dividing and digging up some shrubs. It was very strong for digging and making a path to any root. I used with a pointed shovel to pry the roots out. While this tool is perfect for getting to the root of the problem (pun intended), it is not strong enough to be a pry tool. This was a great purchase I wish I would have made years ago and saved time and muscles.
customer_reviews.author: Candice Harmon

customer_reviews.title: Strong, Lightweight & Priced Well
customer_reviews.text: Excellent, high quality shovel! I was pleasantly surprised to find it lightweight, yet very strong - and at a very reasonable price. It has already had use in the garden. In addition to gardening, I’m using it to dig rocky terrain while metal detecting where it has shown itself to be quite tough. The length is perfect, too - acting as a walking stick while metal detecting. I looked at countless shovels in hardware stores prior to buying this one - they didn’t even come close. I’m 55, and I’m sure this shovel will outlast me.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher R. Stevenson

customer_reviews.title: A "smallish" workhorse shovel!
customer_reviews.text: I am a 77.5 year old female avid gardener with bad knees! I do most of my gardening on a stool ; I've used a regular short shovel for years but this one ..... far exceeds the performance of my old one. I had to plant a nandina in the vicinity of where a 15 ft. blue spruce had to be taken down and stump ground. I have heavy, clay soil with lots of rocks; this shovel cut through all the small remaining roots of the spruce and was able to extricate a medium size rock with no difficulty. Hope this review helps someone make a decision when evaluating other shovels on the market! HAPPY GARDENING!!!
customer_reviews.author: Helen S.

customer_reviews.title: Sharpest tool in the box!
customer_reviews.text: I am not an expert gardener, this spade has helped me work miracles in preparing my flower and veggie beds. It has made cutting through the weed roots ridiculously easy, and I ain’t no spring chicken at 69 years old. This has become my favorite tool for turning over soil and removing weed roots. . Buy it, you will not be sorry!
customer_reviews.author: Louise E.

customer_reviews.title: Very Pleased
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with this purchase. It was expensive for me, but so far has really done the job. I have a small yard with poor quality soil with lava rock on top of it! And, it is overplanted. So, I am spending lots of time uprooting and replanting plants. This shovel gets into narrow spaces, dig deep and cleanly, and does the job with less effort. Exactly what I was hoping for.
customer_reviews.author: Hortbeardie

customer_reviews.title: A spectacular tool!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my wife since she digs the garden beds. (I'm too arthritic to help much.) In rocky Pennsylvania soil, it works wonders. Easy to dig through the clayey soil and get the rocks up as well. It's heavy duty, so won't splinter with heavy use. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Pegleg

customer_reviews.title: If only I'd tried it sooner
customer_reviews.text: This is one great little digging tool. If only I tried it sooner I'm sure I would not have damaged the Ulnar nerve in my hand and elbow from pounding away with other types of shovels, spades and hand spades in my clay soil. This went right in with hardly any effort and made planting shrubs "almost" enjoyable again. I would highly recommend it to anyone who want's to take away the hard work associated with digging and trying to plant shrubs in clay soil. Mine is the Yellow spade with the cushioned D grip.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Medlock

customer_reviews.title: Garden magic
customer_reviews.text: Dug up small flower bed and found it very easily worked around stones and broke up clay. You might want to consider how point end is packaged. It had come through about 6" and could have cut someone.
customer_reviews.author: B Singer

customer_reviews.title: Necessity for gardeners.
customer_reviews.text: Just Fabulous!! A friend gave me one. What a great friend! I gave one to my brother who now truly knows I’m a great sister! This is a great shovel that can do things no other shovel can. You need one.
customer_reviews.author: terry

customer_reviews.title: Very good shovel. shape, size and stringth.  good handle lenght
customer_reviews.text: It is being used to dig holes for planting flowers. Strong and did not bend when digging through hard clay type soil. The blade has a top edge which allows one to use their foot to press it down into the soil. Its tapered shape aids in making small holes for new plantings.
customer_reviews.author: Max

customer_reviews.title: Useful, but...
customer_reviews.text: For most digging jobs, this is the best shovel to use. Not so good in extremely rocky soils and soils having numerous roots. The spear tip design cannot cut anything but the smallest roots, so I have to rely on my hands and garden clippers for the larger roots.
customer_reviews.author: the gadget guy

customer_reviews.title: The best shovel around!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have this shovel already, but my son wanted to borrow it. So................I purchased a shovel for him, and he loves it as much as I do. I live where there is very rocky soil, and I have dug up bolders with this shovel. Highly recommend!!!
customer_reviews.author: Carol E Ferree

customer_reviews.title: Great shovel!
customer_reviews.text: I was able to dig six feet into the ground in almost no time at all. I was skeptical at first due to the short shaft, but it did the job!
customer_reviews.author: Philly Buster

customer_reviews.title: Changed My Life!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tool on recommendations from several master gardeners and so glad I did! The tool is very sturdy, and really does make digging a lot easier. I move plants around a lot, so used it constantly in summer. I was not sure how I would like the size, but I would definitely keep what I have. I am 5’6-1/2” and have shorter size. It’s perfect for me.
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: Great little garden shovel
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy and easy to maneuver, feels goodin your hands, bites in without a lot of effort.
customer_reviews.author: R. Horton

customer_reviews.title: Replace the handle.
customer_reviews.text: I use this shovel for work everyday in all different kinds of terrain. I've been very happy with the performance compared to my old drain spade. However before a year after the purchase the plastic handle broke. I've decided to have the fiberglass shaft and plastic handle replaced with steel. The head of the shovel is best part of the purchase. Still the best spade shovel on the market.
customer_reviews.author: BC

customer_reviews.title: Good, light weight - but not  the same as the Razor Spade
customer_reviews.text: I use this spade in conjunction with the razor spade. They each serve a different purpose. I'll use the Spear Head for normal plant digging for relocation. When I have a tough clump of roots from a plant I wish to relocate - I use the Razor to dig into the root system.
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: Great shovel. Works great on hard clay soil
customer_reviews.text: It is manageable for my sister to plant her plants. A great purchase
customer_reviews.author: MYDEAR9344

customer_reviews.title: Great small spade
customer_reviews.text: This spade is perfect for a small garden. The shape makes it possible to dig in tight spaces, and is terrific for transplanting. The weight is significant for such a small spade head, giving us more power and greater ease in digging a deep hole. It made digging tulip beds much faster and easier--I wish I'd had this years ago!
customer_reviews.author: Brooklyn Grandparent

customer_reviews.title: BEST. SHOVEL. EVER.
customer_reviews.text: My mother brought this shovel over to help me do some landscaping I loved it so much I immediately purchased one. It's quite possibly the best tool in my shed. It's got a handle, it's lightweight, and it has a concise tip like a trowel but with the strength and durability of a full shovel. It's slim so it lets you be exact with what you want to dig up and also can cuts roots! A+++++++++++ Seriously, get one.
customer_reviews.author: CraftyTeacher

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with purchase
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with purchase. Product was exactly as described, sturdy, comfortable handle and nice height for leverage. Was concerned about comments stating disappointment with the blade not being sharpened. The soil I worked up was sandy and full of pea gravel, with a slight moving back and forth of the spade found the blade very suitable. Moistened the section of hard caked dirt which needed to be worked up and found the spade tackled that job easily also. The side foot wings are extremely useful. Job needed a lot of elbow grease...so glad I made this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: elizabeth spangler

customer_reviews.title: made planting a breeze!
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a strong person. This shovel made digging holes for planting very easy! The weight was manageable and the shovel point cut soil easily. I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: V. DeChristofaro

customer_reviews.title: My daughter loves this shovel
customer_reviews.text: I had one for years & when my daughter used it she wanted one. It's a great shovel I use this all the time. It's light but does hard work.
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: Great for my needs.
customer_reviews.text: I have a flower bed that was filled with pea gravel by a former owner. Digging a hole with a regular spade was almost impossible . This shovel worked like a charm. Worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: MarNan

customer_reviews.title: Review for Spear Head Spade
customer_reviews.text: Works great for me. I do have to wet the soil prior to digging, but the spear head spade makes it very precise and quick.
customer_reviews.author: Speed

customer_reviews.title: Sharp, handy, a must have.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect tool for any soil! Garden Club speaker introduced it, and now, having loaned shovel to a friend, I want it back!
customer_reviews.author: Jean McCarthy

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Haven’t really fully tested this shovel yet, but so far so good. Maybe I’ll do an update next spring when I have some bushes that need transplanting.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: Small but sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I bought it originally for some landscaping projects in my yard. My husband liked it so much, he “borrowed” it to use at his job on a construction site. He likes how its metal doesn’t give or bend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best shovel I have ever owned
customer_reviews.text: Excellent for female use, digs deep without a lot of force. Love it, the best shovel I have ever owned
customer_reviews.author: gen sartell

customer_reviews.title: Must For All Gardeners & Light Weight
customer_reviews.text: This was recommended to me by a person on a Garden Forum I am on and a MUST for all avid gardeners, especially women. It's light and the narrow part of the shovel makes it easier to dig holes.
customer_reviews.author: cotto

customer_reviews.title: I love my shovel and it isn’t to heavy
customer_reviews.text: I love my shovel and it isn’t to heavy. The serrated edges helps especially in tree rooted ground. It is made well with the handle it is easier to control as I have arthritis in my hands. I would recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Betty

customer_reviews.title: Just the right size and cuts easily through the very hard compacted clay type soil in ...
customer_reviews.text: Just the right size and cuts easily through the very hard compacted clay type soil in my yard. I struggled a lot with my old rounded spade so this was a great time and back saver!
customer_reviews.author: JAYBEE

customer_reviews.title: Solid shove.
customer_reviews.text: My wife LOVES this little shovel. Works very well in our soil.
customer_reviews.author: DHrivnak

customer_reviews.title: Very versatile
customer_reviews.text: These spearhead shovels are the greatest thing to work in your garden. You can dig out a circle for a tree and pop the plug out, then plant your tree. They work for any landscaping projects you my have.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce

customer_reviews.title: Must have tool for serious gardenerers
customer_reviews.text: The best tool I have found for digging in heavy soil!
customer_reviews.author: Karen S

customer_reviews.title: Moderately Like
customer_reviews.text: I would not recommend as dirt sticks to the surface of the shovel. Design, weight, and ergomatics are great.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: comfortable tool. Great size for a short gardener and ...
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight, comfortable tool. Great size for a short gardener and very easy to control with less than young hands, knees and shoulders. Only wish could remove more soil with blade.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy B Hensley

customer_reviews.title: Ev Rey gardener needs one.
customer_reviews.text: If you garden don’t be without this shovel. It makes transplanting and splitting plants so easy.
customer_reviews.author: ellen

customer_reviews.title: made for digging
customer_reviews.text: awesome shovel for a great grandmother (71) digging for gold in my backyard
customer_reviews.author: Jusme

customer_reviews.title: Durability
customer_reviews.text: A good heavy duty spade. Works great for planting. Slices right thru roots.
customer_reviews.author: ronald j. hax

customer_reviews.title: The more you use the sharper it gets !!
customer_reviews.text: The best shovel ever I work outside a lot for myself and others so I needed a good sharp sturdy shovel it will dig anywhere !!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cuts though tree roots, hard packed clay with minimal effort. Won't be without one of these.
customer_reviews.text: I have had this spear head spade for a couple of years. I love it worked like a champ while living in Montana and absolutely a must have for Georgia clay. I ordered another one only because I can't be without this tool. Michelle Moore
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Moore

customer_reviews.title: Dig with ease!
customer_reviews.text: Works so much better for transplanting perennials than a regular shovel.
customer_reviews.author: Terry M

customer_reviews.title: The Best shovel I have ever owned
customer_reviews.text: The Best shovel I have ever owned. It works great on clay-like soil... just as in the description. Wow!!! I"m impressed .
customer_reviews.author: Michael Valencia

customer_reviews.title: Rock Sturdy Spade
customer_reviews.text: Heavy duty and sturdy to match its excellent engineering and design!
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Depew

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Use for gardening/yard work. We had one and hired someone to do some yard cleanup for us. Let him use our spade and he loved it - we purchased another and gave him one to keep
customer_reviews.author: Elaine

customer_reviews.title: Far better than a standard spade
customer_reviews.text: Performs exactly as stated. Far better than a traditional spade for breaking up clay based soils. I live in the mid-Atlantic where the soil is clay and rock. I’d say it’s necessary for this reason.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Brittingham

customer_reviews.title: it great for her height
customer_reviews.text: my wife bought this for herself. it great for her height.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: This is the best tool ever! I have had surgery on both shoulders and this tool allows me to plant with no stress. The ledge for your foot is perfectly placed.
customer_reviews.author: Anita

customer_reviews.title: Best Shovel Is Ever
customer_reviews.text: Works better than a regular shovel especially for digging up clumps of flowers with lots of roots. Anyone that gardens should have one.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Barto

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great shovel for gardening. Have one and bought this for a gift. Great quality.
customer_reviews.author: J. Arnold

customer_reviews.title: so this has made my life great!
customer_reviews.text: I am getting older and have problems. But want to work in my yard, so this has made my life great!
customer_reviews.author: cora

customer_reviews.title: Does the job!
customer_reviews.text: This spear head spade is perfect for getting out roots or transplanting. It’s very sturdy and the sides allow you to step your weight on it when digging. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Dorothy T.

customer_reviews.title: It's worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: Can't rate durability yet, but so far, so good. Definitely worth the money for digging up roots, etc. haven't tackled rocky areas yet.
customer_reviews.author: Solar Light Lover

customer_reviews.title: HEAVY
customer_reviews.text: much to heavy compared to other shovels in this price range I bought it for metal detecting and it is to heavy to carry for hours at a time
customer_reviews.author: Randolph Bayly

customer_reviews.title: Love the shovel Spade
customer_reviews.text: Great nice and sturdy and no need to worry if you use it at the beach doesn't seem to affect it by rusting.
customer_reviews.author: Katrina A. Hern

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and durable for years of use.  Perfect for Gardeners.
customer_reviews.text: We have used this product for several years and this one as a gift for our kids. It cuts thru sod and roots easily. Would recommend highly.
customer_reviews.author: Meme

customer_reviews.title: love this
customer_reviews.text: absolutely love this for grass removal. made my life so much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Kim J

customer_reviews.title: Even without the cutting teeth, it still cuts through tree roots pretty well.Good shovel for metel detecting.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this shovel hoping it would hold up to the rigorous digging through roots and rocks, and it has performed beyond my expectations, love it!!
customer_reviews.author: Tim sanders

customer_reviews.title: Works great for digging in area with lots of roots
customer_reviews.text: Works great for digging in area with lots of roots. Only drawback was sometimes the blade of the spade will flex if you are not pushing straight down into the ground.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: EASY-PEASY
customer_reviews.text: The shape of this shovel makes digging into the lawn very easy, love it!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Weird looking thing.
customer_reviews.text: My wife is the one who wanted this thing because "Gardening is her Passion" and our yard, which used to be a forest 20 or so years ago, is full of rocks and roots. Personally, I think I need a new excavator to do the job but she seems to think she can get the job done with this weird looking shovel. We live in New England, it has just turned April, and it was what she wanted for Christmas (who am I to judge). She hasn't tried it out yet but When she does, I will re-visit this review.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Ace

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is the best shovel I have ever used. I brought my two sisters one for Christmas.
customer_reviews.author: Sandi

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: I already had one and loved it so that I ordered this one for my daughter.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Kisner

product_meta.title: Spear Head Spade - Reinforced Fiberglass Gardening Shovel with Cushioned D Grip - Award Winning Shovel - Model SHFD3 Yellow
product_meta.description: Color:Short Handle - Model SHFD3YELLOWAll Spear Head Spade blades are designed from the ground up to handle your most difficult digging situations while reducing effort by up to 80%. The blade profile is so special and effective , it has not one but 2 patents. It has the impressive ability to auto-seek the path of least resistance and then gradually ease, wedge, and cut through the most challenging of conditions. Spear Head Spade blades are made of carbon manganese steel that is 33% thicker and 25% harder than normal shovels. They are sharpened from tip to tail at a 35 degree angle to give them an effective and durable edge. They are powder coated with an epoxy resin for durability and ease of cleaning. Generous forward bent foot rests make digging more comfortable, prevent entanglement with roots, and enable the blade to hold more soil. All shovels are made with reinforced fiberglass handles. You will find that they are among the lightest and strongest shovels on the market. They are also highly weather resistant, low maintenance, and non-conductive. Please note - although the fiberglass handle is non-conductive, always contact "Call Before You Dig" before digging and be extra careful when working around electricity. The new and improved SHFD3 model has a larger and softer cushioned D grip, designed to make it easier and more comfortable when doing tough digging and also accommodates gloved hands. The grip also has UV inhibitors that allow it to withstand the harshest outdoor conditions.
feature_bullets: First hybrid shovel/spade guaranteed to significantly reduce digging efforts. 40" light-weight design makes it easy to lift and use.
Awarded "BEST of the BEST" in garden shovels in 2018 and 2019 by independent test lab BESTREVIEWS!
Specially reinforced pultruded fiberglass handle is 60% stronger than EN-3388 shovel/spade standards.
Great for rocky, compacted soils and clay. Excellent for transplanting and dividing highly rooted perennials.
Larger and Softer Cushioned D-grip for more comfort and to accommodate gloved hands.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars140 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
